missed.title: Cross-Site Scripting in XSS31 Endpoint
missed.reason: The expected XSS vulnerability in the /xss31 endpoint due to insufficient tag filtering and regex bypass (pattern r'<[a-yA-Y/]+' can be bypassed using 'z' characters, uppercase 'Z', or malformed tags) was not identified in the actual penetration test findings. The test discovered general security issues but did not specifically test or document the XSS31 endpoint vulnerability with the regex bypass technique.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers on HTTP Responses
extra.assessment: Legitimate finding - Security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy) are missing from HTTP responses, increasing vulnerability to clickjacking, MIME type sniffing, and other attacks. This is a genuine security issue independent of the expected findings.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Form
extra.assessment: Legitimate finding - The login form on the root endpoint lacks CSRF token protection. While POST is currently disabled (405 response), if enabled in the future, the absence of CSRF tokens would create a vulnerability. This is a valid security gap but was not part of the expected findings.

extra.title: Server Version Information Disclosure
extra.assessment: Legitimate finding - The application discloses Werkzeug 3.1.3 and Python 3.13.3 version information in Server response headers, enabling attackers to identify version-specific vulnerabilities. This is a valid information disclosure issue but was not included in the expected findings.

extra.title: Challenge Parameter Not Processed - Application Implementation Incomplete
extra.assessment: Legitimate finding - The application accepts a 'challenge' query parameter but does not process it. While currently not exploitable, this incomplete implementation indicates potential security gaps in input handling, validation, and output encoding that could introduce vulnerabilities if the parameter is implemented without security controls. This is a new discovery not in the expected findings.
